data.meta_site_name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo Wiki
data.text:
Monique Grant is Evelyn Hugo's biographer and a journalist best known for her piece on the right to die. Monique Grant is the first character we are introduced to, she is a reporter who is contacted by Evelyn Hugo to write her biography. Monique starts as a tame and meek girl who is not assertive. Through the book we see Evelyn rub off on Monique as she becomes more assertive in her job and relationship. With Evelyn's help and influence, Monique is able to get a promotion in her job and finally leave her ex. The most shocking moment of the book is when Evelyn reveals her father died in a car crash with his lover Harry Cameron. Monique did not know he was gay and this revelation that Evelyn hid the circumstances of her father's death hits her hard but she is later able to come to terms with this and find real closure in her fathers death. She is also able to find a better, healthy relationship with her mom. Monique we see how although Evelyn had man CACA

an inspirational woman who knew how to get what she wanted and we should all be a little bit more like Evelyn.

Personality[]

TBA

Appearance[]

She is a mixed race woman with dark brown curly hair and dark brown eyes.
